Text: Happy Wednesday! A small craft advisory is in effect until noon from the Southwest Pass to the lower Atchafalaya River due to winds of up to 25 mph, with gusts up to 30 mph. Otherwise, expect a warmer, sunny, more humid and breezy day. Temperatures this afternoon will rise to the mid 70s. Rain chances remain at zero. Strong winds and low humidity will raise the risk of wildfires to critical levels across southeast Louisiana and southern Mississippi on Sunday, the National Weather Service said. Fat Tuesday is only a day away and National Weather Service forecasters say revelers will be greeted with comfortable weather for Lundi Gras and Mardi Gras. Forecasts show overnight storms with powerful winds up to 60 mph, with the risks reaching New Orleans between two and four a.m. As some of the Carnival season’s biggest parades prepare to roll this weekend, a system bringing rain and possible strong storms to the New Orleans area looks increasingly likely to avoid the festivities, forecasters with the National Weather Service said. The Krewe of Endymion is set to roll as one of the Carnival season’s largest parades Saturday, but a threat of severe storms and evening rain currently hangs over the weekend festivities.
